Quinoa Salad with Chickpeas

Jump to Recipe

Welcome to a refreshing and nutrient-packed recipe that is perfect for any meal of the day: Quinoa Salad with Chickpeas. This vibrant salad not only bursts with flavor but also packs a powerful punch of health benefits. Quinoa, often hailed as a superfood, is a complete protein that is gluten-free and rich in essential amino acids. When combined with fiber-rich chickpeas, crisp cucumbers, juicy cherry tomatoes, and aromatic parsley, this dish becomes a powerhouse of nutrition. Ideal for meal prep, picnics, or as a light lunch, this salad is easy to prepare and can be customized to suit your taste preferences. Plus, with its zesty lemon dressing, you’ll find it both satisfying and refreshing. Dive into this simple yet delicious recipe to elevate your salad game today!

Ingredients

quinoa

Make sure to rinse the quinoa thoroughly under cold water before cooking to remove its natural coating, called saponin, which can make it taste bitter. If you don't have quinoa, you can substitute it with couscous, bulgur, or even rice, though cooking times and water ratios may vary.

chickpeas (canned, drained and rinsed)

Canned chickpeas are convenient, but if you prefer, you can use dried chickpeas. Just soak them overnight and boil them until tender before adding to the salad. For added flavor, consider roasting the chickpeas with spices before adding them to the salad.

cucumber, diced

Choose a firm cucumber with a bright color for the best texture and flavor. If you want to reduce the water content, you can seed the cucumber before dicing. Substitutes include zucchini or bell peppers for a different crunch.

cherry tomatoes, halved

For the sweetest flavor, select ripe cherry tomatoes. If they're not in season, you can use regular tomatoes, but be sure to remove excess seeds and juice. Alternatively, sun-dried tomatoes can add a rich flavor.

red onion, finely chopped

Soak the chopped red onion in cold water for 10 minutes to mellow its sharpness if desired. If you prefer a milder taste, you can substitute with green onions or shallots.

parsley, chopped

Use fresh parsley for the best flavor; flat-leaf parsley is preferred for its stronger taste. If you don't have parsley, fresh cilantro or basil can be used as alternatives to add different herbal notes.

olive oil

Extra virgin olive oil is ideal for its robust flavor. If you need a lighter oil, avocado oil or sunflower oil can be used. Consider infusing the oil with garlic or herbs for an extra flavor boost.

lemon juice

Freshly squeezed lemon juice is best for a bright flavor. If you don't have lemons, lime juice can be used as a substitute, or a splash of vinegar, such as apple cider or red wine vinegar, can also work.

salt

Taste as you go to avoid over-salting. If you're watching your sodium intake, consider using a low-sodium salt or seasoning blend to enhance flavor without excessive salt.

black pepper

Freshly cracked black pepper can provide a more aromatic flavor than pre-ground. If you want a bit of heat, consider adding a pinch of red pepper flakes or a dash of hot sauce.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Rinse the Quinoa

    Start by rinsing 1 cup of quinoa under cold water in a fine mesh strainer. This step is crucial as it helps remove the saponins, which can give quinoa a bitter taste. Make sure to rub and swish the quinoa while rinsing.

  • Step 2: Cook the Quinoa

    In a medium saucepan, combine the rinsed quinoa with 2 cups of water. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to low, cover, and let it simmer for about 15 minutes, or until the quinoa is fluffy and the water is absorbed. You’ll know it's done when the grains have expanded and the little tails have popped out.

  • Step 3: Cool the Quinoa

    Once cooked, remove the saucepan from heat and let it cool for a few minutes. Fluff the quinoa with a fork to separate the grains. This will help it cool faster and prevent it from clumping.

  • Step 4: Combine the Salad Ingredients

    In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked quinoa with 1 can (15 oz) of drained and rinsed chickpeas, 1 diced cucumber, 1 cup of halved cherry tomatoes, 1/4 finely chopped red onion, and 1/4 cup of chopped parsley. You can adjust the quantities based on your taste preferences.

  • Step 5: Make the Dressing

    In a separate small bowl, whisk together 3 tablespoons of olive oil, 2 tablespoons of lemon juice, and salt and black pepper to taste. Make sure to taste the dressing before adding it to the salad to adjust the seasoning as needed.

  • Step 6: Dress the Salad

    Pour the dressing over the salad and toss gently to combine all the ingredients. Be careful not to mash the chickpeas; you want everything to stay intact.

  • Step 7: Serve or Chill

    You can serve the salad immediately or let it chill in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes to enhance the flavors. Chilling can help the ingredients meld together and provide a refreshing taste.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I rinse quinoa properly?

To rinse quinoa, place it in a fine mesh strainer and run cold water over it for about 1-2 minutes. This helps remove the natural coating called saponin, which can make it taste bitter.

What is the correct water-to-quinoa ratio for cooking?

The standard ratio is 2 cups of water for every 1 cup of quinoa. This ensures that the quinoa cooks properly and absorbs the water.

How do I know when quinoa is done cooking?

Quinoa is done cooking when it is fluffy and the germ has separated, forming a little ring around each seed. This usually takes about 15 minutes.

Can I use dried chickpeas instead of canned?

Yes, but dried chickpeas need to be soaked overnight and then cooked before using. Canned chickpeas are convenient and ready to eat after draining and rinsing.

How do I chop vegetables safely?

To chop vegetables safely, use a sharp knife and keep your fingers curled under your hand that holds the vegetable, using your knuckles as a guide. Always cut on a stable cutting board.

What can I substitute for parsley in this recipe?

If you don’t have parsley, you can substitute with cilantro, basil, or even spinach, depending on your taste preference.

How can I make the salad more filling?

To make the salad more filling, consider adding ingredients like diced avocado, feta cheese, or cooked chicken.

What’s the best way to store leftovers?

Store leftovers in an airtight container in the refrigerator. The salad is best enjoyed within 3-4 days.

Can I prepare this salad ahead of time?

Yes! You can prepare the salad ahead of time and let it chill in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes to enhance the flavors.

How do I enhance the flavor of my salad dressing?

To enhance the flavor of your dressing, consider adding minced garlic, a pinch of sugar, or a splash of vinegar for acidity.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

This salad is naturally gluten-free and vegan, making it suitable for a variety of dietary preferences. For added protein, you can incorporate feta cheese or avocado for a creamier texture. If you're aiming for lower sodium, opt for low-sodium chickpeas or rinse them thoroughly to reduce salt content.

Pairings

This Quinoa Salad with Chickpeas pairs wonderfully with grilled chicken or fish for a heartier meal. For a vegetarian option, consider serving alongside stuffed bell peppers or roasted vegetables. As for beverages, a crisp Sauvignon Blanc or a light sparkling water with lemon complements the salad's fresh flavors beautifully.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the quinoa salad in a large, shallow bowl to showcase the vibrant colors of the ingredients. Garnish with additional parsley or lemon wedges for a pop of color and extra flavor. For a more casual setting, consider serving in mason jars for individual portions, perfect for picnics or meal prep. The salad can be enjoyed warm or cold, but chilling for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld is highly recommended.

Quinoa Salad with Chickpeas

25 min
$12.5
250 kcal
Difficulty: 20%
Servings: 4

Dietary Tags:

VegetarianGluten-FreeHigh-Protein

Cuisine:

Mediterranean

Tags:

Description

A refreshing and nutritious salad packed with protein and flavor, perfect for a quick meal.

Ingredients

  • quinoa: 1 cup
  • chickpeas (canned, drained and rinsed): 1 can (15 oz)
  • cucumber, diced: 1
  • cherry tomatoes, halved: 1 cup
  • red onion, finely chopped: 1/4
  • parsley, chopped: 1/4 cup
  • olive oil: 3 tablespoons
  • lemon juice: 2 tablespoons
  • salt: to taste
  • black pepper: to taste
